text: Sir Lenox Hewitt (7 May 1917 - 28 February 2020) was an Australian public servant. He was the Secretary of the Prime Minister's Department under John Gorton (Liberal) 1968-71, and Secretary of the Department of Minerals and Energy under Rex Connor (Labor) 1972-75. He remained active in public policy debate.Reform of Australian Government Administration: Building the world's best public service, Submission of Sir Lenox Hewitt OBE He was the father of Patricia Hewitt, a former Labour minister in Tony Blair's government in the United Kingdom. Hewitt died, aged 102, of Lewy body dementia-related problems on 28 February 2020 at a care home in Edgecliff, New South Wales. ==References== Category:1917 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Australian centenarians Category:Politicians from Victoria (Australia)
